repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

comment_data.body:
Could we also try a fused type of `np.float64_t[:]` and `object`. In that case the `dtype="M"` array should match `object` (so not produce any error).

I'm fairly sure it'll work, but it'd be nice to have the explicit test
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -734,3 +734,18 @@ def same_type_after_arrays_composite():
     cdef SameTypeAfterArraysStructComposite element
     arr = np.ones(2, np.asarray(<SameTypeAfterArraysStructComposite[:1]>&element).dtype)
     cdef SameTypeAfterArraysStructComposite[:] memview = arr
+
+
+ctypedef fused np_numeric_t:

comment_data.body:
I suspect @scoder is likely to complain about the non-descriptive naming here.

I'd suggest `test_invalid_buffer_fused_memoryview` maybe?

repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

milestone.description:
Goals:
– New version scheme: 3.x instead of 0.x.
– Change default `language_level` from `2` to `3str`.
– Change default for `binding` directive from `False` to `True`.
– Fix some Python compatibility issues (if possible, allowing for breaking changes).
